content: Hi Infra team, the apple jobs for #88390 (https://github.com/rust-lang-ci/rust/runs/3447984587) stopped without any logs. Can someone please take a look and/or possibly restart bors in case this is a spurious failure
Retried. The apple runners have a tendency to stumble.

Apple fails quite regularly, I remember seeing at least two failures in the past couple days. Have we told github how much trouble we're having? It would be really great not to have to constantly retry PRs ...

https://github.com/actions/runner/pull/1304 was just released over the last couple days and could, I guess, be related. The bors retry log doesn't show many apple failures, though people aren't noting a description all that often
Hmm, I don't think it's been more frequent than normal lately. This has been an ongoing issue.
seems to be hanging, it's been 3 and a half hours: https://github.com/rust-lang-ci/rust/runs/3570504706
i wish we could just re-start one runner instead of the whole workflow
didn't the servo project have something like this?

Mara said:

i wish we could just re-start one runner instead of the whole workflow

it wouldn't matter that much, especially for the slowest jobs like apple
we would still need to keep the whole queue blocked until that runner finishes
yeah. just less chance that another one will run into something spurious the second run. and sometimes it's already clear after like 30 minutes that one of the apples is running very slow
